update.description:
Before compiling, uncomment [gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc:1086](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c20a738814b10cb9fe967053677294bbc806e1d9/gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc?at=model_editor_part1#cl-1086) to enable the model editor.

Part 1:

Features include enabling users to:

- add simple shapes, and import custom meshes as parts (links) to a model

- Add joints to the model

- double click on a hotspot on the joint to configure its properties.

A part inspector for configuring parts will be in the next pull request.

content.raw: I did a few changes to address some of these issues but it's looking like I will need to sacrifice some functionalities (e.g. double click fillers) to make it 100% compatible. Later on there'll be more model editor pull requests and I would face the same issues, so I think I'll just keep this pull request targeted to default.
content.html: I did a few changes to address some of these issues but it's looking like I will need to sacrifice some functionalities (e.g. double click fillers) to make it 100% compatible. Later on there'll be more model editor pull requests and I would face the same issues, so I think I'll just keep this pull request targeted to default.

content.raw:
Here is the [ABI/API compatibility report again gazebo 2.0.0](http://gazebosim.org/compat_reports/pr_710)

It looks like you're close. It may be worthwhile to fix the problems, and target to gazebo 2.0.
content.html:
Here is the ABI/API compatibility report again gazebo 2.0.0

content.raw:
I was imagining that they may want insert a few models from the model database, which would require them to switch in and out of the editor. It also makes their job harder since saving an intermediate state of the model is not yet available.

I think one option is to hide the model when they are not in the editor mode.
content.html:
I was imagining that they may want insert a few models from the model database, which would require them to switch in and out of the editor. It also makes their job harder since saving an intermediate state of the model is not yet available.

I think one option is to hide the model when they are not in the editor mode.

content.raw: When in the model editor I can create a model, not save it, and then Edit-->Model Editor will take me out of the editor but it leaves the unsaved (and transparent) model in the world. Should the editor act the same as "Discard" when doing this?
content.html: When in the model editor I can create a model, not save it, and then Edit-->Model Editor will take me out of the editor but it leaves the unsaved (and transparent) model in the world. Should the editor act the same as "Discard" when doing this?

content.raw:
If you try to save your model in a location where you don't have enough permissions (eg. /root), gazebo closes due to an uncaught exception.


```
#!c++

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::filesystem3::filesystem_error'
  what():  boost::filesystem::status: Permission denied: "/root/defaultModel_0.sdf"
```
content.html:
If you try to save your model in a location where you don't have enough permissions (eg. /root), gazebo closes due to an uncaught exception.

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::filesystem3::filesystem_error'
  what():  boost::filesystem::status: Permission denied: "/root/defaultModel_0.sdf"

content.raw:
added a couple of static helper functions in `ModelManipulator` class for doing this: [GetMousePositionOnPlane()](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/1c8f79e6cb95bfaabadeb3ee631fafd1b13a28c3#Lgazebo/gui/ModelManipulator.ccT135) and [SnapPoint()](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/1c8f79e6cb95bfaabadeb3ee631fafd1b13a28c3#Lgazebo/gui/ModelManipulator.ccT155). They are now reused in `LightMaker`, `ModelMaker`, and `ModelManipulator` classes.

1c8f79e
content.html:
added a couple of static helper functions in ModelManipulator class for doing this: GetMousePositionOnPlane() and SnapPoint(). They are now reused in LightMaker, ModelMaker, and ModelManipulator classes.

1c8f79e

pullrequest.title: Model editor Part 1 - part and joint creation

content.raw:
Currently a joint can have up to 2 axes. So depending on the type of joint, the two loops handle showing and hiding configuration options for the axes. 

e.g. if `axisCount` is  `1`. The first loop show only one group box of joint axis configuration, and the second loop hides the second group box.
content.html:
Currently a joint can have up to 2 axes. So depending on the type of joint, the two loops handle showing and hiding configuration options for the axes.

e.g. if axisCount is 1. The first loop show only one group box of joint axis configuration, and the second loop hides the second group box.
